description: Also known as rap music, is a genre of popular music that originated in the early 1970s by African Americans in the Bronx, New York City. It consists of a stylized rhythmic music that commonly accompanies rapping, a rhythmic and rhyming speech that is chanted.

subgenres.name: Old School Hip Hop (c. 1979â€“1984)
subgenres.description: The first commercially recorded hip hop music. It is noted for its relatively simple rapping techniques, compared to later hip hop, and its focus on party-related subject matter.
key_artists: Grandmaster Flash and the Furious Five

subgenres.name: Golden Age Hip Hop (mid-1980s to early 1990s)
subgenres.description: A period characterized by its diversity, quality, innovation, and influence. It saw the rise of artists who were experimental, afrocentric, and politically charged.

subgenres.name: Boom Bap
subgenres.description: A subgenre and production style prominent on the East Coast during the golden age. The name is an onomatopoeia for the main drum sounds: a hard-hitting kick drum and a crisp snare.

subgenres.name: Trap
subgenres.description: Originated in the Southern United States in the early 2000s. It is typified by its ominous, cinematic, and bleak lyrical content which varies widely, but a common theme is the trap life. Sonically it is defined by its 808 kick drums, layered synthesizers, and intricate hi-hat patterns.

subgenres.name: Drill
subgenres.description: A subgenre of trap music that originated in Chicago in the early 2010s. It is defined by its dark, violent, and nihilistic lyrical content and ominous, trap-influenced beats. Regional scenes like UK Drill have become globally popular.
